article.Heading: Poll: Here's what India Inc expects from Budget 2017
article.Summary: Ahead of the Budget, CNBC-TV18, Forbes India and BMR Advisors conducted pre-budget poll of select CEOs to ascertain the expectations of India Inc from Budget 2017.
article.Body:
Ahead of the Budget, CNBC-TV18, Forbes India and BMR Advisors conducted a pre-Budget poll of select CEOs to ascertain the expectations of India Inc from Budget 2017.

The poll was conducted in December this year, just a month after demonetisation. Top executives stretching across 17 sectors were polled just a month after demonetisation. Every executive was sent an online link to respond the questions and it was anonymous in nature.

As per the poll, 64 percent of the respondents believe that India will see 7-8 percent GDP growth in FY18 while 8 percent feel that the growth number could cross 8 also.

Streamlining policies will be the government's focus in this Budget according to 52 percent respondents.  

Mukesh Butani, Managing Partner at BMR Legal said that Budget expectations are high on back of the demonetisation drive. While reforms have been done, government still has a long way to go.

Sourav Majumdar, Editor of Forbes India believes that demonetisation clearly signals government’s intent to fight against black money in the economy.

India Inc believes that the Goods & Services Tax (GST) Bill will boost the economy. Majumdar said that over time, GST could impact the economic growth by 100 basis points.

Backing the view, Gokul Chaudhri of BMR & Association said that demonetisation followed by GST is likely to push India to higher tax-GDP ratio.

Here are the findings of the poll:

FY18 GDP estimate

- 64 percent of the respondents think FY18 GDP will grow in the 7-8 percent range.

- 32 percent see growth of below 7 percent.

- 8 percent believe it will cross 8 percent.

Will interest rates ease

- 85 percent of the respondents think interest rates will ease going ahead.

- 9 percent responded no.

- 6 percent can’t say.

Key theme of the Budget

- 52 percent believe the Budget will focus on simplify and streamlining policies

- 33 percent believe in infrastructure development

- 15 percent believe in accelerating flagship schemes,

Ease of doing business

When asked about best steps the government has undertaken to ease doing business in the country, CEOs rated the following:

1 - Ease of starting business (39 percent respondents)

2 - Resolving insolvency (38 percent)

3 - Paying taxes (30 percent)

4 - Enforcing contracts (23 percent)

5 - Construction permits (21 percent)

6 - Registering property (20 percent)

7 - Trading across borders (18 percent)

Government's most successful flagship programmes

When asked about most government's successful flagship programmes, CEOs rated the following:

1 - Smart Cities (58 percent respondents)

2 - Jan Dhan Yojana (45 percent)

3 - Skill India (44 percent)

4 - Digital India (35 percent)

5 - Start-Up Mission (27 percent)

6 - Make In India (21 percent)

How will GST rate slabs impact your industry

- 47 percent believe GST rate to have a positive impact

- 21 percent believe to have a negative impact

- 20 percent believe to have neutral

- 12 percent have no view on it

India Inc ready for GST rollout in April

On the question of GST rollout

- 62 percent think that India Inc is partially prepared

- 30 percent think not prepared

- 5 percent think fully prepared

- 3 percent have no opinion.

Will GST provide for the expected boost to economy

- 79 percent think that GST will provide the boost to the economy

- 12 percent think unlikely

- 9 percent can’t say.

Does demonetisation validate government’s commitment to fight black money

On the question of demonetisation validate government's commitment

- 52 percent respondents said that demonetisation will help government in fighting black money

- 42 percent of them somewhat agree

- 4 percent disagree

- 2 percent have no view.
